newsitem.title: TAIWAN: London Forfaiting seeks $50m loan in Asia.
newsitem.headline: London Forfaiting seeks $50m loan in Asia.

text.p: British trade financing group London Forfaiting Co Plc is seeking a US$50 million syndicated loan in Taiwan and South Korea, co-lead underwriter Chinatrust Commercial Bank of Taiwan said on Friday.

"London Forfaiting hopes to raise US$50 million in Taiwan and South Korea, and Chinatrust and SEOULBANK of Korea will be co-lead underwriter for the syndicated loan," Chinatrust spokeswoman Sabrina Wang told Reuters.
She said the loan will make people in Asia aware of London Forfaiting, which in turn will help its future business expansion in the region.
The five-year loan will bear a rate of LIBOR plus 0.6 percentage points, she said.
Both underwriters have started the loan underwriting.
London Forfaiting is also seeking US$100 million in syndicated loan in Europe, she added.
